sectiondef.header: Base pair probabilities and derived computations

briefdescription.para: Get the mean base pair distance in the thermodynamic ensemble from a probability matrix.

detaileddescription.para: this can be computed from the pair probs $ p_{ij} $ as

parameterdescription.para: The length of the sequence
The matrix containing the base pair probabilities

simplesect.para: The mean pair distance of the structure ensemble

briefdescription.para: Get the mean base pair distance in the thermodynamic ensemble.

detaileddescription.para: this can be computed from the pair probs $p_{ij}$ as

parameterdescription.para: The fold compound data structure

simplesect.para: The mean pair distance of the structure ensemble

parblock.para: This function is attached as method mean_bp_distance() to objects of type fold_compound. See, e.g. embed:rst:inline:py:meth:`RNA.fold_compound.mean_bp_distance()` in the :doc:`/api_python`.

briefdescription.para: Compute the Ensemble Defect for a given target structure provided as a vrna_ptable.

detaileddescription.para: Given a target structure $s$, compute the average dissimilarity of a randomly drawn structure from the ensemble, i.e.:

with sequence length $n$, the probability $p_{ij}$ of a base pair $(i,j)$, the probability $q_i = 1 - \sum_j p_{ij}$ of nucleotide $i$ being unpaired, and the indicator variable $s_i = 1$ if $\exists (i,j) \in s$, and $s_i = 0$ otherwise.

simplesect.para: The vrna_fold_compound_t input parameter fc must contain a valid base pair probability matrix. This means that partition function and base pair probabilities must have been computed using fc before execution of this function!

parameterdescription.para: A fold_compound with pre-computed base pair probabilities
A pair table representing a target structure

simplesect.para: The ensemble defect with respect to the target structure, or -1. upon failure, e.g. pre-conditions are not met

parblock.para: This function is attached as overloaded method ensemble_defect() to objects of type fold_compound. See, e.g. embed:rst:inline:py:meth:`RNA.fold_compound.ensemble_defect()` in the :doc:`/api_python`.

briefdescription.para: Compute the Ensemble Defect for a given target structure.

detaileddescription.para: This is a wrapper around vrna_ensemble_defect_pt(). Given a target structure $s$, compute the average dissimilarity of a randomly drawn structure from the ensemble, i.e.:

with sequence length $n$, the probability $p_{ij}$ of a base pair $(i,j)$, the probability $q_i = 1 - \sum_j p_{ij}$ of nucleotide $i$ being unpaired, and the indicator variable $s_i = 1$ if $\exists (i,j) \in s$, and $s_i = 0$ otherwise.

simplesect.para: The vrna_fold_compound_t input parameter fc must contain a valid base pair probability matrix. This means that partition function and base pair probabilities must have been computed using fc before execution of this function!

parameterdescription.para: A fold_compound with pre-computed base pair probabilities
A target structure in dot-bracket notation

simplesect.para: The ensemble defect with respect to the target structure, or -1. upon failure, e.g. pre-conditions are not met

parblock.para: This function is attached as method ensemble_defect() to objects of type fold_compound. Note that the SWIG wrapper takes a structure in dot-bracket notation and converts it into a pair table using vrna_ptable_from_string(). The resulting pair table is then internally passed to vrna_ensemble_defect_pt(). To control which kind of matching brackets will be used during conversion, the optional argument options can be used. See also the description of vrna_ptable_from_string() for available options. (default: VRNA_BRACKETS_RND). See, e.g. embed:rst:inline:py:meth:`RNA.fold_compound.ensemble_defect()` in the :doc:`/api_python`.

briefdescription.para: Compute a vector of positional entropies.

detaileddescription.para: This function computes the positional entropies from base pair probabilities as

Low entropy regions have little structural flexibility and the reliability of the predicted structure is high. High entropy implies many structural alternatives. While these alternatives may be functionally important, they make structure prediction more difficult and thus less reliable.

simplesect.para: This function requires pre-computed base pair probabilities! Thus, vrna_pf() must be called beforehand.

parameterdescription.para: A fold_compound with pre-computed base pair probabilities

simplesect.para: A 1-based vector of positional entropies $ S(i) $. (position 0 contains the sequence length)

parblock.para: This function is attached as method positional_entropy() to objects of type fold_compound. See, e.g. embed:rst:inline:py:meth:`RNA.fold_compound.positional_entropy()` in the :doc:`/api_python`.

detaileddescription.para: For each possible base pair $(i,j)$, compute the probability of a stack $(i,j)$, $(i+1, j-1)$.

parameterdescription.para: The fold compound data structure with precomputed base pair probabilities
A cutoff value that limits the output to stacks with $ p > \textrm{cutoff} $.

simplesect.para: A list of stacks with enclosing base pair $(i,j)$ and probabiltiy $ p $

memberdef.argsstring: (double FAB, double FA, double FB, vrna_ep_t *prAB, const vrna_ep_t *prA, const vrna_ep_t *prB, int Alength, const vrna_exp_param_t *exp_params)
memberdef.name: vrna_pf_dimer_probs

briefdescription.para: Compute Boltzmann probabilities of dimerization without homodimers.

detaileddescription.para: Given the pair probabilities and free energies (in the null model) for a dimer AB and the two constituent monomers A and B, compute the conditional pair probabilities given that a dimer AB actually forms. Null model pair probabilities are given as a list as produced by vrna_plist_from_probs(), the dimer probabilities 'prAB' are modified in place.

parameterdescription.para: free energy of dimer AB
free energy of monomer A
free energy of monomer B
pair probabilities for dimer
pair probabilities monomer
pair probabilities monomer
Length of molecule A
The precomputed Boltzmann factors

briefdescription.para: Compute the equilibrium probability of a particular secondary structure.

detaileddescription.para: The probability $p(s)$ of a particular secondary structure $s$ can be computed as
from the structures free energy $E(s)$ and the partition function
where $R$ is the gas constant and $T$ the thermodynamic temperature.

simplesect.para: The fold compound fc must have went through a call to vrna_pf() to fill the dynamic programming matrices with the corresponding partition function.

parameterdescription.para: The fold compound data structure with precomputed partition function
The secondary structure to compute the probability for in dot-bracket notation

simplesect.para: The probability of the input structure (range $[0:1]$)

parblock.para: This function is attached as method pr_structure() to objects of type fold_compound. See, e.g. embed:rst:inline:py:meth:`RNA.fold_compound.pr_structure()` in the :doc:`/api_python`.
This function is attached as method pr_energy() to objects of type fold_compound. See, e.g. embed:rst:inline:py:meth:`RNA.fold_compound.pr_energy()` in the :doc:`/api_python`.

detaileddescription.para: This file includes various implementations for equilibrium probability computations based on the partition function of an RNA sequence, two concatenated sequences, or a sequence alignment.
